content: * to * until you have made a total of 5 sets of 2 bobbles along the row then mb 1 double_crochet mb 1 double_crochet into the next 16 sts chain 1 and turn row 17 1 double_crochet into each st to end chain 1 and turn row 18 1 double_crochet into each of the first 15 sts *mb 1 double_crochet mb 1 double_crochet mb 1 double_crochet into each of the next 15 sts* repeat until you have made a total of 5 sets of 3 bobbles along the row then mb 1 double_crochet mb 1 double_crochet mb 1 double_crochet into the next 15 sts chain 1 and turn row 19 1 double_crochet into each st to end chain 1 and turn row 20 1 double_crochet into each of the first 16 sts *mb 1 double_crochet mb 1 double_crochet into each of the next 17 sts* repeat from * to * until you have made a total of 5 sets of 2 bobbles along the row then mb 1 double_crochet mb 1 double_crochet into the next 16 sts chain 1 and turn row 21-25 1 double_crochet into each st to end chain 1 and turn repeat row 6-25 five more times then repeat row 6-14 to complete your flower patch you will now have 13 row of bobble flowers jane thompson 2019 to neaten the sides work a row of double_crochet all the way around the blanket working 3 double_crochet into the corners to keep the square shape and fasten_off border the border is worked using crab stitch which is quite simply double_crochet worked backwards and gives a neat corded edge join your yarn to any side of the blanket but do not start on a corner begin by working 1 double_crochet into the first st then insert your hook into the next st to the right and work 1 double_crochet in the usual way keep working 1 double_crochet into the next st on the right all the way round and finish with a slip_stitch fasten_off and sew in the ends jane thompson 2019
